definition.name: NXdeflector
definition.doc: Deflectors as they are used e.g. in an electron analyser.

field.name: type
field.doc: Qualitative type of deflector with respect to the number of pole pieces.

field.name: name
field.doc: Colloquial or short name for the deflector. For manufacturer names and identifiers use respective manufacturer fields.

field.name: description
field.doc: Ideally an identifier, persistent link, or free text which gives further details about the deflector.

field.name: voltage
field.doc: Excitation voltage of the deflector. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher order multipoles, it is an array.

field.name: current
field.doc: Excitation current of the deflector. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: offset_x
field.doc: Spatial offset of the deflector in x direction (perpendicular to ```offset_y```).

field.name: offset_y
field.doc: Spatial offset of the deflector in y direction (perpendicular to ```offset_x```).

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: Specifies the position of the deflector by pointing to the last transformation in the transformation chain in the NXtransformations group.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the deflector as a component in the instrument. Conventions from the :ref:`NXtransformations` base class are used. In principle, the McStas coordinate system is used. The first transformation has to point either to another component of the system or . (for pointing to the reference frame) to relate it relative to the experimental setup. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.
